questions.text: I have people who have explicit permission to call me out when they see something wrong.
I have people who know my specific moral vulnerabilities and check in on them.
When confronted by a friend, I receive it as a gift rather than becoming defensive.
I confront my friends when I see something concerning — I don't let things slide to avoid awkwardness.
questions.principle: Mutual accountability requires courage to speak

questions.text: My accountability relationships have survived confrontation — we've been through hard conversations and stayed connected.
